intro: Triphysaria versicolor subsp. faucibarbata, commonly known as the variable bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. It has compound leaves with small, toothed leaflets and produces yellow or white flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its variable leaf shapes and coloration, which can range from green to reddish.
